reviews.review_msg: Steve is one of the better profs that teaches BUS 254. His lectures will be boring at times but he is somewhat funny as well. The exams are tiring but are not too difficult. Overall, not a bad prof.
Steve is ok but his lecture was unorganized. Hard marking on the exam.. Would not take again with him
I love him so much, hes my fav! I dont usually give a rating or comment, just read and leave. But Weiming Liu is the best out of the best! He makes SFU and Accounting great again! Thanks

Weiming made BUS 254 an approachable course. He explained concepts clearly and welcomed any questions we had. Attendance is necessary because of the marked in-class group quizzes but the question pools for them are in the syllabus. His exams were super fair and reflected the homework and tutorial problems. He also allowed formula sheets on exams.
It is not an easy course, to be honest; he is a nice instructor and always willing to help his students. But the exams are pretty easy and straightforward, so choose him confidently!

Midterms & exams are WAY harder than what she makes you think (and her hints are low-key bad and don't help with studying at all). Not enough time with midterms and exams... everyone in the exam was there until the VERY END. Make sure you have a good group for the quizzes; otherwise, you will be below the average in the course.

EVERYTHING IS ON PAPER. MIDTERMS AND EXAMS ARE SUPER HARD AND NOTHING LIKE HER PRACTICE QUESTIONS. GROUP QUIZZES SOLELY DEPEND ON IF YOU HAVE A GOOD GROUP OR NOT. DOESN'T GIVE ENOUGH TIME FOR HER MIDTERMS AND EXAMS... ENDS UP BLAMING YOU FOR BAD TIME MANAGEMENT EVEN THOUGH SHE FINISHES LECTURES LATE AND EVERYONE IN THE CLASS DOESN'T FINISH no joke

If I could tell my past self one thing about this class, it would be to try my absolute best on everything before the final. Participate in tutorials every day, do good in tutorial quizzes and most importantly, the midterm. I am saying this because of the difficulty of the final exam, which will contain questions you have not seen before.

Hwee is a good prof who genuinely cares about her students' learning. Her lectures can be boring, but after all, it is accounting. She provided more than enough resources and help to succeed in this class. Overall, she's a lovely person and wants to see you do well. Her exams were very hard, but the course is curved. Do better than most, get an A.

prof's tests are not like the practice at all, they are way too long for the time given and much more difficult. the course overall is challenging, however, the exams were made far more challenging than necessary

Dr. Tan was good at presenting the material in a easy way to understand whether or not you are going into accounting. Homework felt meaningful to do, but note that the Speedy Guide will only be as useful as you make it. Big chunk of grading is on midterm/final, and the biggest issue is answering an unnecessary large # of questions in only 2-3 hrs.

Didn't appreciate prof's grading style; requires you to do homework according to her style instead of your own learning style. weekly quizzes contain different content than HW and exams are so strictly graded that you must know the exact formats of like 8 different budgets studied in each chapter. got an A in bus251 but am not doing well with Hwee.
I'm not a ppl who really into accounting, but Tan is actually make everything easier. Although she's lecture pace is slow but she will be super patient and helpful if you ask her any questions.

She gave us chocolate on the first day of lecture, amazing first lecture! She clearly is very knowledgable and cares for all students. She is funny and uses great informative examples of real-life situations to explain concepts.
Great prof would take again

Dr Tan was a fantastic professor. She was very passionate about the subject material and really cared for her students and wanted them to do well. Dr Tan's exams were difficult, especially the final, but she provided many resources and practice questions for them. The course was not easy, but I would 100% recommend doing it with Dr Tan.

I enjoyed taking BUS254 with Dr. Tan. She made her lectures engaging and easy to follow along. She does not require the textbook, but reading it helped me. Her exam is very similar to the homework questions, so practice those. There are group quizzes and homework checks during tutorial, but these assignments are very straightforward.

I LOVED BUS254 with Dr Tan. Her lectures are extremely informative and cover all content needed for the class making it actually worth it to go to class each week. There is weekly written homework and group quizzes. Only thing I didn't like was that the final (58%) was worth WAY more than the midterm (19%).

The course is hard and there is a lot of material to learn but Dr. Tan is kind and definitely well educated on the course. The most stressful part is the final worth 58% and midterm worth 19%. Attend all tuts so you can get marks on the weekly quizzes, participation and hw. Luckily, my TA was cool (shoutout Donovan). Study hard, it's worth it.

Hwee Tan is a good professor and is passionate about this course. She doesn't grade any of the work, but I found the TA's to be tough graders. I also found it odd that my TA gave me 0/1 on some homework checks when I completed all my work for every week.

254 was a hard course, and Dr. Tan certainly tried to make it as simple as possible. I used to hate accounting back in 251 but in 254 Dr. Tan is great with explaining concepts with examples. The material itself were a lot, by attending all lectures will help significantly. Attendance to lecture is optional but tutorial attendance are worth marks.

shes honestly an average prof, she records all her lecture which is very nice. Tutorial is mandatory, weekly hw checks, notes check, and quizzes worth 20% of your grade. does not respond to any emails, pray you have a good TA who will excuse any tuts u cant make
Very passionate and good teacher. Hard course, but Tan is great

Dr. Tan needs to revise this course. There is too much weight on exams (77%) & they are extremely difficult. The tutorials have homework every week also. She also makes us complete a useless study guide for marks.
Dr. Tan was an okay professor. She cares quite a bit about her students & wants all of them to succeed, but I was not fond of her course criteria. The 58% final & quizzes every week adds up.

BUS254 is a fairly difficult course, with a lot of homework and hard tests and exams. Therefore, some people may have put lower ratings for how hard the course is. Though, Hwee Tan is a great professor, and the homework she assigns will help you prepare for exams. Schedule accordingly as this course requires a lot of work.

Dr. Tan isn't a bad professor entirely, but her course should be revised. There's a lot of homework that takes hours to complete weekly. No big deal as this can be expected. However, most of your grade (approximately 80%) is based on the midterm and final, with the final having excessive weight. These exams are way harder than homework.

This class is the most challenging business course I've taken so far, mainly due to her surprising exams. Dr. Tan did not provide enough time during both the mid-term and the final exam, and the questions were way more challenging than the practice questions that she had provided. Tutorials are mandatory as well. Thank god this class is curved..

Dr. Tan is a very rational professor. She lays out the material in a way to be studied easily, and she provides all the resources for you to understand the content. Her sense of humour helps one learn rather than impedes it. All around a solid prof.

Dr. Tan made what might seem like complicated topics alot easier with her well thought-out lecutres.Textbook is helpful before lectures. Homework is very doable, just give yourself time and get those participation marks in tutorial for easy marks. Ask questions during lecture breaks, she's very helpful. Final is tough but midterm was okay.

The final was one of the hardest exams I've ever taken. Beware of time because she likes to put lots of questions on her exams while only providing a short time frame. Exam questions were nothing like the homework.

Dr. Tan is an amazing prof who truly cares about her students and wants them all to succeed. In tutorials, there are weekly group quizzes which can be time consuming so hopefully you get a good group. The midterm and final were hard so it's important you study everything (lectures, notes, WileyPlus practice questions, quizzes, and sample exams).

Hwee Tan is such a sweet prof but she made the midterm and final difficult. Almost all the students took the full 3hrs to finish the exam and even then I couldn't answer all the questions because some were quite hard. However, because of the curve, everyone's grade will be boosted

Dr. Tan is an amazing prof!! She genuinely tries to make students' lives easier by catering to exactly what you need, even giving you points for simple participation and hw completion. Her exams are very fair and tested directly from her lectures. To do well: Do the problem sets at the end of every chapter and mark them with the super caring TAs!

Get ready for hours of writing useless annotations and a cheat sheet which you dont even use during exams. Her exams are doable, but her homework system is frustrating asf and makes you not want to study the content. Its like a math class where you have to show your work for every single little detail, its just annoying. I wish praise ma taught 254
She's nice, caring. She made Accounting so easy and understandable. Final is pretty tough I must say. As long as you put the work and take it serious then you will get the grade you deserve.

she's the queen fr. I hate accounting but she made it make some kind of sense. If you're lost on something, she gets straight to the point and caters to your problem so that YOU get it. Genuinely encouraging & kind to students and exams are fair. Her negative reviews are cause she was a lil tough when online started but rest assured she's 5/5.

Dr. Tan is a smart woman, but her lectures are insanely dry. 71% of themark was based on the midterm and final, and the rest were through participation, weekly homework, and weekly quizzes. Homeworks take time, quizzes are done in tutorials, and full participation marks "can only be given to a few people." Prepare well for exams and you'll be fine.

254 is hard, but she does her best to make it easy. i did well on the group quizzes, hw, average on the midterm, failed the final BADLY and still got a C+ even tho the final is 46%. Lectures over textbook, she'll ask about lecture examples. final is so hard, try ur best. participate in tuts to get the 4%, and hw every week. start the hw early!

I asked for a form of accommodation and Dr Tan was unwilling to accommodate. Completely ignored my vulnerable state. I felt as if she did not understand that I was performing poorly due to personal problems and not because of my understanding of course content. I had to set aside my feelings to go from a C- to B,not allowing me to cope during COVID

Dr. Tan is an absolute gem. She is very caring and explains concepts clearly. You have weekly homework assignments that are not too hard and with each question, you have to write a reflection that will boost your homework mark. Participation in the tutorial and do the homework and the class will be smooth sailing.

Dr. Tan did a pretty good job teaching the class overall. There is quite a bit of homework that is assigned each week, but it helps you understand the course material as it is somewhat tough. There are weekly group quizzes during tutorials, but they aren't too difficult. Overall, Tan did well and it seemed like she actually cared about students.

Dr. tan is such a sweet prof. She genuinely cares about her students and tries to make the material enjoyable as hard as it is for accounting. She explains the concepts in a very straightforward that makes them easy to understand. She also adapted this semester based on the feedback she got from students last semester so her exams are a lot fairer!

Dr Tan is one of the sweetest profs ive ever had. she genuinely cares about her students and wants all of them to do well. bus254 is not an easy subject to understand, but her lectures are very clear and makes you very interested in the accounting. her exams and quizzes are fair, and youre able to do well in them if you watch her lectures.

Intro accounting concepts can be difficult to explain. Relative to other profs, Dr. Tan does a good job explaining the concepts. For my class she had all of the lectures prerecorded from fall 2019. Watch those on 1.6x speed and take notes. Much better than watching in person. Also, tutorials have a lot of group work and participation.

The prof was absolutely the worst one I have had so far, the lectures were different than the hw, the hw was different than the midterm, the midterm format was different than the final. Everything was very different. Take the prof if you are up for surprises. Good luck if you take her

Dr. Tan is such a gem! She is sweet but also strict and fair! her lectures are so easy to understand and she made me excited about accounting which is not usual. She marks fairly too. The midterm and final are also not too hard or easy! overall, great experience!

At first she seemed okay but then her midterm was NO WHERE NEAR WHAT WE WERE LEARNING. They said more than half the class failed but didn't want to give us the actual percent. In her final, she made people share their room which seemed to be a breach of privacy and made people lose time writing the exam...

I have a few things to state: 1.) Do not take this Prof at any costs. 2.) Unneccasary workload put on students by Prof. 3.) Save yourself, choose a different Prof. 4.) Her exams are no where close to how she teaches or how her practice questions are.

I just came to realize how bad this prof is. Youtube videos make more sense than her. She is very confusing and ontop makes a very confusing exam. Guys stay away from this prof, you will be so stressed after doing her notes and exams because they arent correlated at all. Notes seem so simple. Exams are 100 times harder. Be warned!!

This course has to be the worst 200 level course there is. This prof over-complicates material and has totally twisted questions on the exams. Stay away from her. Chose another prof as this one will make you frustrated to the point where you want to drop out of school. Her material and lecture notes are very long and boring. Exams are very tough!!

Prof can make exams easier but instead seems like she loves to overwhelm students with information. Not enough time and too many questions. I hope she reads this and changes her way of teaching. Test me the way you have taught on your lecture notes, stop trying to trick us. I am trying to learn the material not play games with the tricks you play.

Do not take this class with her, she may seem like a sweet and caring professor but do not be fooled. She spins everything on the exams and sends you into panic mode. I should have listened to my friend, he took her last semester and felt the same. Her exams are nothing like tutorial questions. The Prof just reads off the slides, cant teach at all!

If you are reading this please avoid her at all costs! She may seem sweet but oh geez her midterm was a nightmare. Especially during covid-19 online platform. Her homework was a walk in the park compared to the midterm. The homework is fair but the midterm was HARD. I got an A in bus 251 i shall be lucky if I pass her class due to the way she is :(

Shes hardcore. The homework she gives are too easy because the midterm she gives is much much more difficult than the homework questions. For example, questions like job cost order has too many details all over the place that you have to take into account when it comes to calculation. Her homework doesnt prepare you for the exams at all.

Dr Tan is extremely knowledgeable and knows what she's talking about. (PhD in accounting) if you ever are unsure about how to do homework, she is very helpful in office hours and you can easily ask questions in tutorials, TAs were good too. The final was very difficult and 99% of the class took the entire 3 hours, so the curve is probably low.
very hard final and not enough time

Midterm was easy. Just do tutorial questions and youll be fine. The final exam is where things went downhill. She made a super hard exam, and 3 hours was not enough to do the whole thing. Expected it to be same level of difficulty as the midterm, but the final was not like the work done in tutorials.
real hard exam

Dr. Tan is good prof. who wants her students to excel and she tries to give every resources to practice outside class including her class recording. To do well it's not necessary to attend the lecture but take advantage of the class recording and DO THE WEEKLY HOMEWORK. Exams are fairly challenging but doable.

Dr. Tan has an innate ability to communicate ideas to her students. Her lecture slides are very clear, informative and visual which are suitable for all learners. She is very approachable for help as well. Highly recommend!

Dr. Tan is a all around great lecturer who shows her interest in accounting, makes concepts very clear, organizes the material well, and prepares lectures content well. Her recordings of the lectures make it easy to go back and review any unclear concepts, but I would recommend going to lectures, as she encourages questions to ensure understanding.

Tan show her passion for teaching accounting during the lecture. and she really care about her students, she provide online recording. The difficulty of the test is fair. Try all questions after each chapter, you should be fine.
Dr. Tan is a very nice lecturer, and provides online recordings for her classes. Midterm and final was pretty hard, but if you study hard an A is achievable.

Professor Tan explains concepts well and goes more in depth in her slides. I don't find it a struggle listening to her. I think she is clear and helpful. She's really helpful on the emails. An approachable lady as well. She cares for her students and willingly answers any questions. Just study the slides, do the weekly homework, read textbook.

Tan is a good prof if you're an accounting major. If not, her class is overly complicated and requires a ton of practice and intuition. Reading lecture slides and knowing terms and ideas is crucial opposed to other 254 classes. Methodical learning is not the best bet because her exam questions can be very tricky.
Straight forward class, if you read textbook/ppt slides and do all the problems you should be good.

All she does is reads off the slides, and many people are bored due to that. If you are capable to keep your focus even when a professor is literally reading word for word the you should choose this professor.

Dr. Tan is a great lecturer. She is able to explain important details of the slides. Also, she is always prepared. She has made her own slides to fit with what she wants to teach. If you practice all of her practice/homework questions and understand key concepts, the class will be not bad.

Do all the tutorial and practice problems and you will do very well in her class. I thought she did a very good job lecturing as she was concise and clear. Also, she seemed to be very knowledgeable on the subject. I would take the class with her again.

Lecture slides were easy to understand but were uploaded on canvas. She basically reads the lecture slides but understands what she's teaching. Do the readings and a lot of practice on homework questions and you should do fine.
Boring lecturer hardest midterm and final I've taken.
not a bad professor at all

Lectures could be a bit better.  Often time you hear a bunch of words and phrases all rushing into ur ears but u have no idea what he was talking about.  Anyways Nice Prof!  He likes to joke around sometimes, which makes the lectures a little less boring. Do ALL ur assignments and Redo them a few times to get good marks. Pretty Tough Exams!

Pretty nice professor.  The materials are alright, but the last part of the course can be difficult.  The exams and marking were fair as a whole.  If you are going to take 254, Spector is a decent choice.
No Comments
read the txtbook if u want a good mark ...lecture, u can go if u hv nth to do...dont' rely on the powerpoints and the exam prep.  the prof is nice ^^

Dont go to the lecture it is a waste of time. He is an extremely nice person though. Read the book 4 times! thats all you need. AND do questions as much as you can. The materials are easy but questions can be confusing.
His exams are fair boz he said he hate tricky questions.So just study his notes and you will be fine.
Nice guy, not very useful lectures. fair exams. Overal he gets a B in teacihng. he is kinda funny too.
No Comments
He never responds to your email, unfair!Even though you got A, but you only learned a little.

He is a well-meaning teacher, he tries to make everyone get a good grade, as long as you keep up with assignments, and do practice exams questions, and online (mcgraw-hill) multiple choice questions you can get an A. I did, and i missed over half the lectures. he's pretty funny too, for an accountant
Simply da BEST! My first ever "A+"
A great prof....just do ur readings and do as many problem, and exercise questions in the text!!
would you like some more crispy creams????????
Agree with last comment.  BUT he's very nice and forgiving because he actually cares about his students.
his nice, friendly, but yet i count on textbook rather than his lecture
He gives you the easiest examples but the tests are way harder!
easy course, funny guy, great class.
He makes an "academically challenging" course comprehensive with his slades and teaching ability. Exams were a little on the difficult side but were fair. Do you homework!
Great prof!
Great Prof.. funny and nice!!! Exam was too long but not very difficult!!  Best lectures ever cause he is soooooooo funny
Great prof. you can tell he spent a lot of time on his lecture slides. exams and final was fair.
nice one
great teacher... exams were fair
No Comments
Very easy course which means that very competitive too. Our class average was 87%.
He was very clear and did not try to trick you purposely.  Great Prof

Arsineh is one of the sweetest professors at SFU! She really cares about her students. Her slides and notes are useful for exams. Midterm and final are fair and based on what is taught in lecture. The textbook is useful for practice questions and clarification if needed.

She is beautiful, very friendly and nice. By attending the lectures, you will know what is expected in the tests. She is very clear about what is important in every lecture. Also, she always asks for students' feedback in order to improve her teaching skills properly. Besides, she gave students Valentine chocolate.  You'll not regret if taking her

She is beautiful, very friendly and nice. By attending the lectures, you will know what is expected in the tests. She is very clear about what is important in every lecture. Also, she always asks for students' feedback in order to improve her teaching skills properly. Besides, she gave students Valentine chocolate :) you'll not regret if taking her

I wish I hadn't chosen her as my prof for BUS 254. She speeds through lectures and you cannot absorb anything therefore it makes going to lectures a waste of timepointless. She does give out examples that are really helpful and will appear on the test. The final was easier than the midterm especially if you do her practice questions many times.

She isn't as easy as the reviews here make her seem. The mid-term was quite long, but the material in it was not super hard. The final was easier and I finished it faster than the mid-term. The lectures are long, but it is because there is just so much material to cover. Study what she points out and you'll do fine.
Truly cares about the students. Teaches very well, is very thorough. Easy to listen to/understand. Material is simple. Plus, she's hot.

easy course. most of the content are based on calculation. Her midterm was a bit tough but final was easy. Key to success in her class is to attend all the classes and listen carefully what questions are going to be on the exams. Yes, she will tell you.
THE BEST PROF EVER!!!!!!!!!!!! she really cares about her student, and tell you exactly what she expected on the exam!!! THE BEST PROF EVER!!!!!!!
BEST. PROF. EVER. the class itself can be difficult if you dont keep up with work but she makes it so much better, she knows how to teach and she is hilarious and CUTE :)

Entertaining and helpful prof. She's adorable during lecture. Tutorial is utterly useless b/c all u do is sit there and listen to students who can't speak english try to present solutions to problems. Unfortunately it's mandatory. Exams are fair, she'll let you know what to expect.The course itself is hard so study study study!
Extremely helpful and caring prof, will go out of her way to accommodate. The material is not hard, textbook and lectures used extensively.

Nice teacher. She makes it pretty clear what will be on  the exams and what isn't very important. She's not very strict with keeping people quiet, which sucks a bit, but if you don't sit in the back you should be fine.

She is very nice! try to get a spot on her tutorial. It is not hard to pass the course,but not easy to get a good grade either (b+ and up). Don't miss lectures as she will say what will appear on the exam. Loved the course and the prof!
Sadly, the 2nd person below, did not study.
Final was really hard!!! But thankfully, she really cares about her students that gave us relateivly high grades compared to other profs

During review session, she stated that students will be tired for the 7-10pm final exam. Therefore, she promised to make it more bearable. Sadly, she didn't live up to the bargain.  I  had nightmares when I slept after the exam.

Easy-going Prof. She gives away candies to keep students motivated. She actually gives hints on what is on the exam in class. Mid-term is easy. Class average is like 70%. Final is considerably difficult. But her class is scaled and her average is a B- but not C+. This course itself is hard, but getting a decent grade in her class is not that hard:)

A quality prof that cares about the subject and her students. It IS a hard subject, but she makes it bearable. Yes, the final is ridiculous but it's a curved class so does it really matter? If you keep up with readings and do the homework each week, it's actually not bad at all. Go to her office hours if you need help and you should be fine.

the Final is the hardest one i've ever met so far in sfu.the textbook is not good at all, u don't have any extra practice for this stupid sfu-published textbook (251 is a really good one), so most of the them would be painful when   they take the final exam. Most of the questions you must really familiar with, however,  you just don;t know how to d

I like her as a person. She is really approachable and friendly. Midterm is O.K. but the final is a heart-breaker. I saw many students came out of the classroom with a stern face. Overall, it's a nice prof but you better study hard.

prof is extremely helpful and very approachable. the course itself is pact with LOTS of info. midterm was bearable, but final....wow ppl got raped 23/90 students failed 25%...that's a huge amount. the final was BRUTAL...though=( overall the prof is great, and i do not think another teacher can do a better job than she does! recommend!!!!!!!!
GREAT BUS PROF I've ever met!!!Love her :) very helpful, strongly recommand

SUPER nice prof, the BEST prof I have ever had in SFU.. she really care about her students n try to help them as much as she can, though it's a hard course dry material but she is the best for BUS254  coz she make it lill   bearable.. she try to give high grade but cant coz of the bus scale.. sheeven get DRUNK 3 days if she give a student F grade !

Great lecturer, tries to make the boring material as interesting as it could be. She hands out free candy!! Reading the textbook and keeping up with the class is 100% essential. Midterm was very difficult. Final is moderate if you prepare. Overall a wonderful, helpful and extremely nice prof.

Not the BEST prof, but a good prof still, for bus 254.  Due to the fact that 254's course material is hard to start with, this course is not easy at all.  But her exams are VERY FAIR, just do all the exercises for every chapter, and understand the steps and procedures, and you will get a good mark.  Attendance is NOT MANDATORY.  Don't procrastinate

She is the nicest professor I have ever had! I went into her office for a quick question and she spent 20 minutes going over other course material with me. She is extremely approachable, very helpful and super nice!!!!!!

AMAZING prof! So much personality makes this boring class bearable. Her exams are hard cuz she has to scale but she gives maximum amount of high grades out as possible. SO helpful, very clear, very approachable, very funny!! One of the best I've had in 2.5 years at SFU
Nice prof. who gives out candy. She tried, just that the course material is too dry and hard. REALLY hard exams.
such a nice prof. explains things extremely well and really cares about her students. def recommend =)
Wonderful lecturer. Very considerate. Always cares about the thoughts of students.
She is nice but the exams are hard. Plus, there's intense competition for grades as it's scaled. For example, only 2% of the class gets an A+.
Very hard prof, super low averages for the class exams. Do not trust if she say easy exam they are both tough.
GOOD PROF GIVES U CANDY COURSE MOFO HARD THO
had easy examples in lecture notes of questions but midterm she asks much harder questions.

I took her class and she was very intelligent. I read other reviews and she never told us what was on the mid terms or the finals but I think what people are trying to say that she teaches and helps on those points. Very helpful and she managed to keep me awake! Amazing teacher, no doubt.
Very very helpful, tells what is exactly on the midterm and final and is VERY fair!!!!! Love her!!!!!

This prof is super nice! This is the first time she teaches at SFU. I hope she will be here to teach in the future. She tells you exactly she she expects for MT and final and formats of the questions look alike to our practice questions!
She is amazing!! so nice, helpful and kinda funny. she always makes time for questions and tells you exactly what she expects you to know for midterm/final. shes the best!!
shes so nice! very very helpful. encourages questions and extremely helpful. thats all i can say.
Tough class, tough teacher ... if you don't work hard.  Derek is fair and flexible, and fairly easy to understand.  Just pay attention to details.

Class is somewhat boring, but that's expected. Derek explains material fairly clearly. Must do assignments and practice problems. Class is curved and everyone does so well that it's difficult to get a good grade.

really need to do the hw and textbook exericises in order to do well in class. class is very competitive, so hard to get a good grade. reasonable exams however, as long as you do the homework and understand the concepts. boring class, and answers to the hw are not discussed in tutorial nor posted

It's not a hard course, exams were reasonable, but beware who are you taking with, since everyone did soo well.. a good grade will not be easy, but I think he wont really fail anyone if you just work fine. Alternative: Steven Spector
Lectures are boring.  Work on the assigned and additional problems and you'll do ok on exams.  Exams are easy but too long since you are less likely to have enough time to doublecheck your work.

The MT and Final isn't hard at all (75% avg for MT) but it is hard to get good grades because everyone is doing so well, he explain the concept very well and very helpful in webct. Do the assignments, they are very helpful
Derek is very helpful and clear. Lecture is a bit boring tho. Exams are fair. Really have to do the homework assignment yourself in order to get good grade in this course.
The problems in class and assignments are relatively easy.  However, the final and midterm are horribly hard, without any practice final or midterm available.  Horrible long boring lectures as well.
Good personality, tried to help me out during office hours.  The final was relatively difficult but it's a difficult class.  His lectures are VERY boring, and unncessary if you can read the textbook.
No Comments

final exam was VERY difficult-you have to REALLY understand the course in order to get a good mark.there was a lot of complaint from the class b/c we only learn the basics in tutorial and in hw. he doesn't even give sample exams! class was boring, course is boring. good luck.
A pretty bad prof. Sure, he is clear and the tests are generally easy, but he is really boring and mono-toned. He also does not actively try to help outside of class.
The asian version of the teddy bear.

solving the additional homework practice questions, in class tutorial questions, slides would be your best help for this course. The exams are completely based on the above, tutorial participation + in class group quiz matter, so don't miss out on those. Overall easier than BUS 251 for sure.
I really recommend Teresa! Do the homework and score well on the midterm and you'll be alright!

ofc the contents were tough tho, i would say her course was 10/10.
exams were very straightforward, if you do homework and additional homework well, you'll be fine with the exams. 
lectures were not mandatory, I also didn't go often, but tutorials were mandatory. they were inclass team quizzes and homework checking by TA.

She is an excellent professor who ensures the material is easy to understand. Her approach simplifies learning and makes it easier to follow along. Attending her lectures is highly beneficial, as she explains all the concepts thoroughly and at a comfortable pace, significantly reducing the need for extensive self-study.

She was just reading off the slides the whole time. She did try to give examples, but the fact that she spoke at 10 words per second made it less than ideal to follow. Basically she was just rapping tbh

Overall course structure is very straightforward. Midterm worth 25%, final worth 50%, and the remaining 25% spread across tutorial participation, tutorial assignments, and homework checks in tutorial. Course work is heavy on theory and calculations. If you read slides/textbook and do practice questions/homework you'll do good.

Coming to lectures was pointless as you could not understand anything in class and it was boring due to her monotone voice. You have to teach yourself and there is a lot of content to grasp. The final was worth 50 percent, making or breaking your grade. To do well study every week and watch yt videos as the slides and lectures did not help.

Matt is a really nice and caring professor, and he gives as much material as he can to prepare you, but the pros of taking a class with him stop there. His voice is monotonous and his lectures are him reading off the textbook notes. Tutorials - homework answers read to you. Get ready to read and practice everything yourself.

Matt isn't the greatest professor. His lectures are rather pointless as they are taken directly from the textbooks. Tutorials are useless as well as you just get homework answers read to you. Exams were pretty fair. He is a nice guy but his ability to teach is rather limited.
